content.formatted_body:
In the proposal {} explicitly matches Object, but destructuring does not. By restricting {} to Object you can't have patterns like

match (value) {
}

m.new_content.formatted_body:
In the proposal {} explicitly matches Object, but destructuring does not. By restricting {} to Object you can't have patterns like

match (value) {
  when String & { length: 3 }: ...;
}

content.body: IMO, the only things that shouldn't match `{}` are `null` and `undefined`.
content.formatted_body: IMO, the only things that shouldn't match {} are null and undefined.

content.body: yeah that seems like an oversight.
`{ length: 0 }` needs to match an empty string, eg
content.formatted_body: { length: 0 } needs to match an empty string, eg

content.body: * `{ length: 0 }` needs to match an empty string, for example
content.formatted_body: * { length: 0 } needs to match an empty string, for example

m.new_content.body: `{ length: 0 }` needs to match an empty string, for example
m.new_content.formatted_body: { length: 0 } needs to match an empty string, for example
